posts.content: Hi, I am parsing Google weather DATA, everything works fine with one single data (for example temp_f.data), but how can I retrieve different data (for example both temp_f and temp_c)?Can I use a single string to do so and if yes what is the syntax? Thank you! Andrea
posts.author: pejobass

posts.content: The parse string for ThingHTTP will only return one result. You could setup two ThingHTTP requests, but your application may not allow for that.What are you building?
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: I am building an Arduino weather station that get the data fom an RSS weather site. I am trying tio have the parse info on a server and then retrieve it with an Arduino client. Andrea
posts.author: pejobass

posts.content: Cool!
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: Hi everybody, I'm just trying everything out here for the first time. So far so good, I have digital sensor data (open/closed) running from an xbee to an arduino and then up to a ThingSpeak channel. That part is working a-ok. Yay! However, I'm having a heck of a time getting React to work. I'm testing both a posting via prowl and directly to twitter and neither is working. Ideally I want it to post when the value for a field changes. For example: Field 1 going from 0 to 1. Trying to make the react from that change isn't working. Nor is just having it react if a channel hasn't been updated after a period of time. Is anyone else having problems? Or is it me? Thanks!
posts.author: tomarthur

posts.content: We are investigating. Thanks for reporting.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: We have update the documentation for the TweetControl app:http://community.thingspeak.com/documentation/apps/tweetcontrol/TweetControl allows you to monitor Twitter for trigger words and trigger a ThingHTTP request. The CheerLights project uses TweetControl to update its ThingSpeak Channel so other lights could stay in sync with each other.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: I receive the message Invalid API Key with the ConnectPort with http://api.thingspeak.com/apps/thingtweet/1/statuses/update?api_key=****************&status=TESTTWITTER and the same URL posted in my browser (Safari or IE) do the right job and change my Twitter message
posts.author: richardchabot

posts.content: I would try 'encoding' that second '&' sign with '%26' - a lot of these passthru gateways do not like '&' signs.Let us know if that works.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: No, it does not workRichard
posts.author: richardchabot

posts.content: Invalid key might be from the '?' symbol. Try '%3F' in replace of the '?'.What is generating the string that is sent through the XBee?
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: BTW:I am using this table to find the URL encode of these special chacters.http://blooberry.com/indexdot/html/topics/urlencoding.htmUse the 'Code Points (Hex)' column.A space is '20' hex, so you use '%20' in the URL.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: Thank you, I am using the same table and i tested every special character, the string is generate by CoolTerm. I will check the Python program of Xig too If i found i let you know.
posts.author: richardchabot

posts.content: Xbee Parameter:The Packetization Timeout (RO) must be to 0 and you can send more than 72 charactersEverything OK
posts.author: richardchabot

posts.content: I have signed up for a thingspeak account on thingspeak.com. Where is the API key ? How do I get a ThingSpeak API key ?
posts.author: wlewis

posts.content: Click Channels, and create a new one. Once you have a channel, you have an API key to put data into the channel and can create read keys for other apps.
posts.author: hans

posts.content: Howdy, Having fun with ThingSpeak !!! While implementing Google Gauge, I noticed that it only seems to work on Public channels.  Is there any way to use Google Gauge with Private channels ?? Thanks   DennisB
posts.author: DennisB

posts.content: Glad you're having fun 🙂Create a Read API Key and pass that in the request for a Channel's feed. Use key=READKEY on the end of the channel feed request.You can create as many READKEYs as you want, one for your web page, another for a LabView application, etc. You can delete them or deactivate them when you want.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: I'm finding that it's not unusual for tweets sent via ThingTweet to never show up on Twitter, even though the server response is HTTP/1.1 200 OK.Anyone have any ideas on what might be going on? Below are server responses from three tweets, the first two of which never posted on Twitter. The first two were sent about a second apart from each other, not sure if that's an issue, they both do come through sometimes.HTTP/1.1 200 OKServer: nginx/0.8.53Date: Thu, 01 Sep 2011 18:33:28 GMTContent-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8Transfer-Encoding: chunkedConnection: closeVary: Accept-EncodingStatus: 200ETag: 'c4ca4238a0b923820dcc509a6f75849b'Cache-Control: max-age=0, private, must-revalidate110HTTP/1.1 200 OKServer: nginx/0.8.53Date: Thu, 01 Sep 2011 18:33:29 GMTContent-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8Transfer-Encoding: chunkedConnection: closeVary: Accept-EncodingStatus: 200ETag: 'c4ca4238a0b923820dcc509a6f75849b'Cache-Control: max-age=0, private, must-revalidate110HTTP/1.1 200 OKServer: nginx/0.8.53Date: Thu, 01 Sep 2011 18:34:50 GMTContent-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8Transfer-Encoding: chunkedConnection: closeVary: Accept-EncodingStatus: 200ETag: 'c4ca4238a0b923820dcc509a6f75849b'Cache-Control: max-age=0, private, must-revalidate110
posts.author: JChristensen

posts.content: If messages are similar in a certain amount of time, the Twitter API rejects the post. You get a 200 OK from ThingSpeak, because the transaction is good to that point.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: Good to know. Are you aware what the parameters are, i.e. what amount of time, and how 'similar' is determined? In this case I wouldn't have considered the two messages to be similar. Even so, I would have expected the first message to be posted regardless.My application sends two tweets when it starts up. They are canned messages and don't vary from one startup to the next. Sometimes both make it, sometimes neither. If Twitter is dumping them, then it would seem that it's not being consistent about it.
posts.author: JChristensen

posts.content: Some of our JavaScript did not render on older versions of Internet Explorer. We recently updated our charts and they work great all the way back to Internet Explorer 6. We have not tested older than that though.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: This is a cool post -- I just got started using ThingSpeak and wired this up using Powershell and my Wi-Fi thermostat.http://myblog4fun.com/archive/2011/06/28/filtrete-3m-50-wifi-thermostat.aspxhttp://myblog4fun.com/archive/2011/07/04/filtrete-3m-50-wi-fi-thermostat-and-thinkspeak.aspxNow that Google is retiring Google PowerMeter, it would be nice if ThingSpeak supported receiving the same type of data.http://myblog4fun.com/archive/2010/10/17/currentcost-envi-and-google-powermeter.aspxhttp://myblog4fun.com/archive/2011/06/24/google-retires-powermeter.aspxMy next task is to get my Netduino Plus running the code via C# and publishing to Pachube and ThingSpeak.
